content.p: Identify which of these vector fields \mathbf{F}_1, \mathbf{F}_2 is a gradient vector field. For what f(x,y) is your choice \mathbf{F}_i=\nabla f(x,y)?

outtro.p: \mathbf{F} = \langle {{fx}}, {{fy}} \rangle is a gradient vector field of f(x,y)={{F}}, since {{fx}}=\frac{\partial}{\partial x} [ {{F}} ], and {{fy}}=\frac{\partial}{\partial y} [ {{F}} ].

content.p: For the function and vector field f, \mathbf{F}=\nabla f you chose above, use the Fundamental Theorem of Line Integrals to compute \displaystyle \int_{ {{P}} }^{ {{Q}} } f(x,y)\ d\mathbf{r}.
